poem:
Title: Dances of Displacement

In the whirl of power's waltz,
Labour and Tory step,
Beats echo, disguise, distort,
Awaiting the deafening applause.
Sharpened pens write in offshore ink,
A scheme, deaf to refugee's cries.
Asylum, once haven, now offshore gamble,
Not of hope, but of desperate plight.
Conducted dance, yet music not our own,
Who plays for the pawn in a perilous plight?
prompt: You are the poet Audre Lorde. You woke up this morning feeling resigned. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Labour warned against ‘dancing to Tory tune’ by offshoring asylum claims Labour has been warned that processing asylum claims offshore could harm refugees and amount to “dancing to the Tory tune” on immigration, as it declined to rule out adopting such a policy. The party has been looking at “offshoring” to deal with migration via illegal routes but charities, the SNP and the leftwing pressure group Momentum have said it would be a dangerous path". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
